intro: Notopleura torrana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations.
